bosses.title: Boss: Type Guardian of Refraction
bosses.short_description: Refactor a messy JS auth module into a strict TypeScript module with unions, type guards, and a clean public API.
bosses.long_description: You are given a startup-style auth module with loose JavaScript objects, stringly-typed status fields, and ad-hoc runtime checks. Your mission is to impose a strict TypeScript model: define Credentials, User, Session, and a discriminated union AuthResult. Implement well-typed authenticate and supporting helpers, plus type guards for success/failure. The result should be easy to use, easy to test, and safe in strict modeâ€”no implicit any, no blind casting.

bosses.title: Boss: Curator of the Generic Arsenal
bosses.short_description: Design a small, reusable generic collection toolkit for TypeScript that feels publishable as an internal library.
bosses.long_description: You are handed a grab-bag of copy-pasted list utilities from multiple teams. Your task is to design and implement a generic collection arsenal: pluck, groupBy, indexBy, mergeById, and ensureUnique. All helpers must be generic, strongly typed, and pleasant to use. No any in the public API. Call sites in example code should infer types automatically.
